name: UpdateWebhookSubscription
description:
Update an existing webhook subscription.

This tool updates an existing webhook subscription in PagerDuty. It should be called when you need to change any details of a webhook subscription, except for the `delivery_method`. Ensure you have the required OAuth scope: `webhook_subscriptions.write`.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the webhook subscription to be updated.

parameters.name: api_version_header
parameters.description: Specify the API version to use by setting the Accept header, which acts as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the content type for the request, must be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription_description
parameters.description: A short description of the webhook subscription.

value_schema.description: A short description of the webhook subscription.

parameters.name: webhook_events
parameters.description: List of outbound event types the subscription will receive.

value_schema.description: The set of outbound event types the subscription will receive.

parameters.name: filter_object_id
parameters.description: The ID of the object used as the filter. Required unless the filter type is account_reference.

value_schema.description: The id of the object being used as the filter.  This field is required for all filter types except account_reference.

parameters.name: filter_object_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of object used as the filter: 'account_reference', 'service_reference', or 'team_reference'.

value_schema.description: The type of object being used as the filter.

parameters.name: oauth_client_id
parameters.description: The ID of the OAuth client for authenticating webhook requests. This field is optional.

value_schema.description: The ID of the OAuth client to use for authenticating webhook requests. Optional field.

parameters.name: send_webhook
parameters.description: Set to true to send a webhook. Default is true. False to disable.

value_schema.description: If true, a webhook will be sent. True is the default state. If false, a webhook will not be sent.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription.description
parameters.description: A short description of the webhook subscription.

value_schema.description: A short description of the webhook subscription.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription.events
parameters.description: The set of outbound event types the subscription will receive.

value_schema.description: The set of outbound event types the subscription will receive.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription.filter.id
parameters.description: The id of the object being used as the filter.  This field is required for all filter types except account_reference.

value_schema.description: The id of the object being used as the filter.  This field is required for all filter types except account_reference.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription.filter.type
parameters.description: The type of object being used as the filter.

value_schema.description: The type of object being used as the filter.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription.active
parameters.description: If true, a webhook will be sent. True is the default state. If false, a webhook will not be sent.

value_schema.description: If true, a webhook will be sent. True is the default state. If false, a webhook will not be sent.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription.oauth_client_id
parameters.description: The ID of the OAuth client to use for authenticating webhook requests. Optional field.

value_schema.description: The ID of the OAuth client to use for authenticating webhook requests. Optional field.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
